## AlBehaviorPromise class

AlBehaviorPromise is a simple extension of Promise that replicates the functionality provided by RxJS's BehaviorSubject. Promises already provide multicasting functionality, but it can be deucedly inconvenient to provide an inline executor, and rather obtuse to change the resolved value.

This class exposes the basic surface area of a Promise -- it is `then`<!-- -->able -- but allows the resolved value to change if necessary.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class AlBehaviorPromise<ResultType> 
```

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [getValue()](./common.albehaviorpromise.getvalue.md) |  | Gets the last resolved value. |
|  [isFulfilled()](./common.albehaviorpromise.isfulfilled.md) |  | Gets the fulfilled/pending state of the underlying promise. |
|  [reject(reason)](./common.albehaviorpromise.reject.md) |  | Rejects the underlying promise with the given reason. |
|  [rescind()](./common.albehaviorpromise.rescind.md) |  | Resets the promise back into an unfulfilled state. |
|  [resolve(result)](./common.albehaviorpromise.resolve.md) |  | Resolves the underlying promise with the given value. |
|  [then(callback, error)](./common.albehaviorpromise.then.md) |  | Attaches a resolve/reject listener to the underlying promise. |
